result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Lovert Granville was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $250.00 PLUS all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge. Bail on deposit to apply. Costs are to be paid by 06-08-2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Credit for 3 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Court advised due to felony conviction, the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario Lovert Granville

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund packet.  vp
Bail Notice mailed to surety on 03/13/17.  vp

AS TO COUNT 1
Court ordered defendant to serve 3 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Defendant to pay a fine of $250.00 PLUS all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA surcharge). Bail on deposit to apply. Costs are to be paid by 6/8/2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. Parties have reached a resolution.

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Mario Lovert Granville in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties ready to proceed to trial. Court ordered case passed to address court calendar.

Defendant Mario Lovert Granville in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  Defense requests a jury trial date.  Neither party wishes to address the court on the record.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.  Case adjourned to Branch 18.  Jury trial scheduled for March 8, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mario Lovert Granville in court.  Attorney Ann T. Bowe appeared earlier.  Jay Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Attorney Bowie in trial in another court.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 18.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mario Lovert Granville in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM
Case scheduled for Jury Trial, however Assistant District Attorney Jay Pucek is in Jury Trial in another court.  Case adjourned for Final pre-trial.  Court selected a date when ADA Pucek is in Branch 18.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mario Lovert Granville in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter in court for a Pretrial Conference. The September 19, 2016 Jury Trial STANDS.

Certification of RETURN ON WARRANT/INITIAL APPEARANCE transcript commencing 05-03-2015 received and filed. (19 Pages.)CH
Copy of transcript forwarded to: MILWAUKEE COUNTY DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S OFFICE ASSISTANT DISTRICT ATTORNEY KAREN LOEBEL.

Defendant Mario Lovert Granville in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Margaret Anne Kunisch for Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a status conference.  The Defendant wants a trial.  A stipulated request for a new court date, received and filed.  Matter set for a pre-trial conference on August 29, 2016 at 8:30am and a Jury Trial on September 19, 2016 at 9:00am in Br. 18, Judge Colon's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

ALL PARTIES WERE NOTIFIED THAT AS OF AUGUST 1, 2016, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE PEDRO COLON, BRANCH #18, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION

Defendant Mario Lovert Granville in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a status conference.  The Defense requested the matter be adjourned until after the trial regarding another case the Defendant has.  No objection from the State.  A stipulated request for adjournment, received and filed.  Matter is adjourned to May 24, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court for a status conference.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Mario Lovert Granville in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Pre-Trial Conference.  The Defendant has a trial pending in another court and parties agreed to adjourn this matter until after the trial in the other court.  The Court VACATED the January 25, 2016 jury trial date.  A stipulated request for adjournment, received and filed.  Matter is adjourned for a status conference to February 26, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

FILED, State's Witness List
FILED, State's Requested Jury Instructions

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court with defendant Mario Lovert Granville.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a status conference.  Matter is set for a pretrial conference on December 15, 2015 at 1:30pm and a Jury Trial date set for January 25, 2016 at 9:00am.

FILED, Felony Scheduling Order

Defendant Mario Lovert Granville in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Case adjourned to September 16, 2015 at 1:30pm for a projected guilty plea.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Mario Lovert Granville not in court, in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared TELEPHONICALLY for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 08-13-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea Hearing.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Mario Lovert Granville not in court, in custody.  
Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defendant in custody on homicide charges (15CF2358).  Joint request for status date granted.
  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mario Lovert Granville in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:William Savagian-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM022664  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/03/2015

Defendant Mario Lovert Granville in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Mario Lovert Granville in custody.  Katryna L. Childs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
